remarks: An infinite product equals the value its sequence converges to. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 18-Dec-2017.)
statement:
iprodclim.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iprodclim.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
iprodclim.3 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. Z E. y ( y =/= 0 /\ seq n ( x. , F ) ~~> y ) ) $.
iprodclim.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
iprodclim.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
iprodclim.6 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( x. , F ) ~~> B ) $.
iprodclim $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. Z A = B ) $.
$d A n y $.
$d F k $.
$d M k y $.
$d Z k n y $.
$d k n ph y $.
